Module contents

Backend.Main package

Submodules

Backend.Main.ChatHelper module

Chat Helper Module

Backend.Main.ChatHelper.checkSentiment(chatHistory: list) → float[source]

This method calculates the average sentiment of the last 5 messages in the chatHistory :param chatHistory: List of last 5 messages in the chat :return: sentiment_value: average sentiment of the last 5 messages

Backend.Main.ChatHelper.create_chatbot(chatHistory: list) → MessageToClient[source]

This method creates a chatbot and forwards a list of the last 5 messages to it :param chatHistory: List of last 5 messages in the chat :return: message: Answer from the chatbot

Backend.Main.ChatHelper.is_message_addressing_bot(message_str: str) → bool[source]

This method analyses if a message is addressing the chatbot. For this, it compares the similarity of the incoming string with the keyword “botify” :param message_str: Incoming message as a string :return: Bool: True if the incoming message is addressing the chatbot, False otherwise

Backend.Main.ChatHelper.listenToMessages(chatHistory: list) → MessageToClient | None[source]

This method listens to incoming messages and determines whether the chatbot should be called :param chatHistory: List of last 5 messages in the chat :return: message object or None: either return a message from the chatbot or None if the chatbot is not addressed

Backend.Main.Sentiment module

Sentiment Module

Backend.Main.Sentiment.sentiment_analysis(message: MessageFromClient) → MessageToClient[source]

This method analyses the sentiment of a given message :param message: incoming message without a sentiment :return: message: analysed message with a sentiment

Backend.Main.Server module

Server Module

class Backend.Main.Server.ChatServerFactory(url)[source]

Bases: WebSocketServerFactory

Factory for WebSocket Servers

broadcast(message, sender)[source]

This method broadcasts the message to all clients in the chat :param message: The message to broadcast :param sender: Sender client of the message

getUsernameAndLang()[source]

This methods compiles a list of all usernames and languages participating in the chat :return: List of clients and their set language

register(client)[source]

This method adds a client to the list of chat participants :param client: client to be registered

sendCurrentUsers()[source]

This method sends a list of all clients currently registered to the server

unregister(client)[source]

This method removes the client from the list of chat participants :param client: client to be removed

class Backend.Main.Server.ChatServerProtocol[source]

Bases: WebSocketServerProtocol

WebSocket Server

chatHistory = []
onClose(wasClean, code, reason)[source]

Implements autobahn.websocket.interfaces.IWebSocketChannel.onClose()

onConnect(request)[source]

This method connects a client to the server :param request: incoming request from the client

onMessage(payload, isBinary)[source]

This method receives a message from a client, calls translation, sentiment analysis, chatbot and distributes it among the chat participants :param payload: incoming message from the client :param isBinary: Boolean indicating whether a message is binary or not :raise HTTPStatus: 400 Bad Request if the incoming message is malformed

onOpen()[source]

This method registers a new client when the connection is openned

Backend.Main.Translator module

Translator Module

Backend.Main.Translator.translate_text(message: MessageFromClient | MessageToClient) → MessageFromClient | MessageToClient[source]

This method translates an incoming message into the language specified in the message field message.language :param message: incoming message in orignial language :return: message: translated message
